repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
Fix #25974

This behavior is same with Vim.

comment_data.body: Why wouldn't we want a cursor here?
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -255,7 +255,7 @@ describe(':confirm command dialog', function()
       :set ro | confirm w                                                        |
       {6:'readonly' option is set for "Xconfirm_write_ro".}                          |
       {6:Do you wish to write anyway?}                                               |
-      {6:(Y)es, [N]o: }^                                                              |
+      {6:(Y)es, [N]o: }                                                              |

comment_data.body:
`:confirm w` means `:write` command.
So the cursor will be hidden.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -255,7 +255,7 @@ describe(':confirm command dialog', function()
       :set ro | confirm w                                                        |
       {6:'readonly' option is set for "Xconfirm_write_ro".}                          |
       {6:Do you wish to write anyway?}                                               |
-      {6:(Y)es, [N]o: }^                                                              |
+      {6:(Y)es, [N]o: }                                                              |

@@ -255,7 +255,7 @@ describe(':confirm command dialog', function()
       :set ro | confirm w                                                        |
       {6:'readonly' option is set for "Xconfirm_write_ro".}                          |
       {6:Do you wish to write anyway?}                                               |
-      {6:(Y)es, [N]o: }^                                                              |
+      {6:(Y)es, [N]o: }                                                              |

comment_regular_data.body: please rebase
OK.  I will do it.
Rebased now.
Fixed the tests error.

Hm...

```
FAILED   test/functional/terminal/tui_spec.lua @ 2415: TUI with non-tty (pipe) stdout/stderr
test/functional/terminal/tui_spec.lua:2428: Row 4 did not match.
Expected:
  |:w testF                                          |
  |:q                                                |
  |                                                  |
  |*[Process exited 134]^                              |
  |                                                  |
  |                                                  |
  |{3:-- TERMINAL --}                                    |
Actual:
  |:w testF                                          |
  |:q                                                |
  |                                                  |
  |*[Process exited 1]^                                |
  |                                                  |
  |                                                  |
  |{3:-- TERMINAL --}                                    |

To print the expect() call that would assert the current screen state, use
screen:snapshot_util(). In case of non-deterministic failures, use
screen:redraw_debug() to show all intermediate screen states.

Snapshot:
screen:expect([[
  :w testF                                          |
  :q                                                |
                                                    |
  [Process exited 1]^                                |
                                                    |*2
  {3:-- TERMINAL --}                                    |
]])

stack traceback:
	test/functional/ui/screen.lua:852: in function '_wait'
	test/functional/ui/screen.lua:517: in function 'expect'
	test/functional/terminal/tui_spec.lua:2428: in function <test/functional/terminal/tui_spec.lua:2415>
```

I don't reproduce the error.
The error code may be changed?

I have changed the behavior.
`ui_busy_start()` is executed when `buf_write()`.

I have added macOS check.  I don't know why it is needed though.
It depends on terminal configuration??

It seems another pattern.  Why?

```
FAILED   test/functional/terminal/tui_spec.lua @ 2412: TUI with non-tty (pipe) stdout/stderr
test/functional/terminal/tui_spec.lua:2436: Row 4 did not match.
Expected:
  |:w testF                                          |
  |:q                                                |
  |                                                  |
  |*[Process exited 134]^                              |
  |                                                  |
  |                                                  |
  |{3:-- TERMINAL --}                                    |
Actual:
  |:w testF                                          |
  |:q                                                |
  |                                                  |
  |*[Process exited 1]^                                |
  |                                                  |
  |                                                  |
  |{3:-- TERMINAL --}                                    |

To print the expect() call that would assert the current screen state, use
screen:snapshot_util(). In case of non-deterministic failures, use
screen:redraw_debug() to show all intermediate screen states.

Snapshot:
screen:expect([[
  :w testF                                          |
  :q                                                |
                                                    |
  [Process exited 1]^                                |
                                                    |*2
  {3:-- TERMINAL --}                                    |
]])
```
I have added asan check.

```
ERROR    1 error, listed below:
ERROR    test/functional/testnvim.lua @ 1014: after_each
test/testutil.lua:378: Found runtime errors in logfile(s): /home/runner/work/neovim/neovim/build/log/asan.22486

stack traceback:
	test/testutil.lua:378: in function 'check_logs'
	test/functional/testnvim.lua:1015: in function <test/functional/testnvim.lua:1014>


 46 SKIPPED TESTS
 1 ERROR
```

I don't know...

> I don't know...

Me neither, but you'll find the backtrace if you search for "sanitizer" in the test log: https://github.com/neovim/neovim/actions/runs/14829553477/job/41629959412?pr=29447#step:10:6892.

> search for "sanitizer" in the test log:

```
= ==22493==ERROR: AddressSanitizer: ABRT on unknown address 0x03e9000057dd (pc 0x7fbed089eb2c bp 0x7ffc3c31f5f0 sp 0x7ffc3c31f5b0 T0)
=     #0 0x7fbed089eb2c in __pthread_kill_implementation nptl/pthread_kill.c:44:76
=     #1 0x7fbed089eb2c in __pthread_kill_internal nptl/pthread_kill.c:78:10
=     #2 0x7fbed089eb2c in pthread_kill nptl/pthread_kill.c:89:10
=     #3 0x7fbed084527d in raise signal/../sysdeps/posix/raise.c:26:13
=     #4 0x7fbed08288fe in abort stdlib/abort.c:79:7
=     #5 0x560e8c77c2a2 in uv__epoll_ctl_flush /home/runner/work/neovim/neovim/.deps/build/src/libuv/src/unix/linux.c:1338:7
=     #6 0x560e8c77b941 in uv__io_poll /home/runner/work/neovim/neovim/.deps/build/src/libuv/src/unix/linux.c:1451:9
=     #7 0x560e8c761d57 in uv_run /home/runner/work/neovim/neovim/.deps/build/src/libuv/src/unix/core.c:460:5
=     #8 0x560e8c3266b9 in flush_buf /home/runner/work/neovim/neovim/src/nvim/tui/tui.c:2642:5
=     #9 0x560e8c340262 in tui_flush /home/runner/work/neovim/neovim/src/nvim/tui/tui.c:1584:3
=     #10 0x560e8c374380 in ui_client_event_flush /home/runner/work/neovim/neovim/build/src/nvim/auto/ui_events_client.generated.h:64:3
=     #11 0x560e8bc21040 in parse_msgpack /home/runner/work/neovim/neovim/src/nvim/msgpack_rpc/channel.c:255:11
=     #12 0x560e8bc17357 in receive_msgpack /home/runner/work/neovim/neovim/src/nvim/msgpack_rpc/channel.c:217:5
=     #13 0x560e8b618171 in read_event /home/runner/work/neovim/neovim/src/nvim/event/rstream.c:180:23
=     #14 0x560e8b617bc1 in invoke_read_cb /home/runner/work/neovim/neovim/src/nvim/event/rstream.c:233:3
=     #15 0x560e8b6150d4 in read_cb /home/runner/work/neovim/neovim/src/nvim/event/rstream.c:135:3
=     #16 0x560e8c773b08 in uv__read /home/runner/work/neovim/neovim/.deps/build/src/libuv/src/unix/stream.c:1148:7
=     #17 0x560e8c771a1a in uv__stream_io /home/runner/work/neovim/neovim/.deps/build/src/libuv/src/unix/stream.c:1208:5
=     #18 0x560e8c77bc6f in uv__io_poll /home/runner/work/neovim/neovim/.deps/build/src/libuv/src/unix/linux.c:1565:11
=     #19 0x560e8c761d57 in uv_run /home/runner/work/neovim/neovim/.deps/build/src/libuv/src/unix/core.c:460:5
=     #20 0x560e8b603f2d in loop_uv_run /home/runner/work/neovim/neovim/src/nvim/event/loop.c:61:3
=     #21 0x560e8b603b94 in loop_poll_events /home/runner/work/neovim/neovim/src/nvim/event/loop.c:82:26
=     #22 0x560e8c37eaa2 in ui_client_run /home/runner/work/neovim/neovim/src/nvim/ui_client.c:183:5
=     #23 0x560e8b9c111a in main /home/runner/work/neovim/neovim/src/nvim/main.c:347:5
=     #24 0x7fbed082a1c9 in __libc_start_call_main csu/../sysdeps/nptl/libc_start_call_main.h:58:16
=     #25 0x7fbed082a28a in __libc_start_main csu/../csu/libc-start.c:360:3
=     #26 0x560e8ae66f64 in _start (/home/runner/work/neovim/neovim/build/bin/nvim+0xc6bf64) (BuildId: c6affd46c395dbff6f8c6511ac1729243f2247f0)
```
I have added `ui_flush()`.
Hm...  I have changed `ui_busy_start()` and `ui_busy_end()` is called in `filemess()`.

Hm....  It is hard to fix the error.
`ui_busy_start()` cannot be called?  Can you help me?
debugging this takes time. that's why it wasn't done yet.

I debugged this quickly the problem seem to be that an empty buffer is passed to `uv_write`

The following patch seems to fix it for me at least (also reverting the changes to the test)
```diff
diff --git a/src/nvim/tui/tui.c b/src/nvim/tui/tui.c
index 7332a84166..b100657334 100644
--- a/src/nvim/tui/tui.c
+++ b/src/nvim/tui/tui.c
@@ -2635,7 +2635,7 @@ static void flush_buf(TUIData *tui)
     }
   } else {
     int ret
-      = uv_write(&req, (uv_stream_t *)&tui->output_handle, bufs, ARRAY_SIZE(bufs), NULL);
+      = uv_write(&req, (uv_stream_t *)&tui->output_handle, bufs, bufs[2].len == 0 ? 2 : 3, NULL);
     if (ret) {
       ELOG("uv_write failed: %s", uv_strerror(ret));
     }
diff --git a/test/functional/terminal/tui_spec.lua b/test/functional/terminal/tui_spec.lua
index 164076ea1a..cc0bc7cfad 100644
--- a/test/functional/terminal/tui_spec.lua
+++ b/test/functional/terminal/tui_spec.lua
@@ -2422,37 +2422,15 @@ describe('TUI', function()
       { VIMRUNTIME = os.getenv('VIMRUNTIME') }
     )
     feed_data(':w testF\n:q\n')
-    if is_os('mac') or is_os('freebsd') then
-      screen:expect([[
-        :w testF                                          |
-        :q                                                |
-        abc                                               |
-                                                          |
-        [Process exited 0]^                                |
-                                                          |
-        {3:-- TERMINAL --}                                    |
-      ]])
-    elseif t.is_asan() then
-      screen:expect([[
-        :w testF                                          |
-        :q                                                |
-                                                          |
-        [Process exited 1]^                                |
-                                                          |
-                                                          |
-        {3:-- TERMINAL --}                                    |
-      ]])
-    else
-      screen:expect([[
-        :w testF                                          |
-        :q                                                |
-                                                          |
-        [Process exited 134]^                              |
-                                                          |
-                                                          |
-        {3:-- TERMINAL --}                                    |
-      ]])
-    end
+    screen:expect([[
+      :w testF                                          |
+      :q                                                |
+      abc                                               |
+                                                        |
+      [Process exited 0]^                                |
+                                                        |
+      {3:-- TERMINAL --}                                    |
+    ]])
   end)
 
   it('<C-h> #10134', function()
```

Note that the patch is not very good, it should probably check the length of the other buffers as well.
The cursor visibility escape codes could also be totally excluded when the output is a pipe, but that's a minor problem, it seems to be done automatically somewhere anyway.
Thank you!  I have applied your patch.
All tests are passed.

title: fix: call ui_busy_start() and ui_busy_stop() when :write
